data.description: At Devon, we will offer you a career full of energy and unmatched opportunities to solve today’s greatest challenges. Innovation, creative problem-solving and positive change happen when people step out of their comfort zone and think differently. Our values, workplace practices, wellness programs, benefits and compensation are aimed at helping employees manage their unique personal life and care for their families so they can focus on contributing to the fullest. We are seeking motivated and curious interns to join our Technology team for a focused internship in Data Analytics. This program provides exposure to advanced analytics tools, real-world business challenges, and collaboration with experienced professionals across Devon. Responsibilities: Collaborate with technology and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and business objectives. Assist in querying, manipulating, and analyzing large data sets using modern analytics tools. Support the development and maintenance of data visualization dashboards and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders. Participate in the creation and documentation of analytical workflows and reporting processes. Help identify patterns, trends, and opportunities within business data to support decision-making. Provide support for application and reporting solutions, troubleshooting issues and ensuring data accuracy. Learn and apply best practices in data quality, data governance, and data security. Engage in team meetings and cross-functional projects to gain exposure to business operations and technology strategies. Stay current with emerging analytics technologies and industry trends through active learning and professional development. Technology Exposure: Databricks Azure DevOps PowerBI Power Apps SharePoint SQL and scripting languages Additional data analytics and business intelligence tools Education: Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related discipline. Preferred Skills & Competencies: Basic understanding of data analysis, data visualization, and SQL. Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities. Effective oral and written communication skills. Interest in business operations and technology-driven solutions. Willingness to learn new tools and collaborate with diverse teams. Digital literacy and attention to detail. What You’ll Gain: Real-world experience in data analysis and business analytics. Mentorship from industry leaders and experienced professionals. Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and business processes. Opportunities to contribute to impactful projects and present findings to stakeholders. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran or other characteristics protected by law. For more information on Equal Employment Opportunity, please follow these links: EEO is the Law EEO is the Law Supplement Pay Transparency Provision Stay connected by joining our network! Enter your e-mail and tell us a bit about yourself, and we'll keep you informed about upcoming events and opportunities that match your interests. Extraordinary work begins with extraordinary people. At Devon, we employ the best people to push boundaries, develop new ideas and take us further.
